alert.note: Alert for Santa Clara; Santa Cruz (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 20 at 7:25AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Santa Clara and Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until 830 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 725 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Jose, Sunnyvale, Santa Clara, Mountain View, Cupertino, Gilroy, Campbell, Morgan Hill, Saratoga, Los Gatos, Los Altos, Seven Trees, Sunol-Midtown, Buena Vista, Fruitdale, Rancho Rinconada Cdp, Cambrian Park, San Martin and Rancho Rinconada. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
